data:
Facsimile Images

⸢Θ⸣(εοῖς) Κ(ατακθονίοις)
Ἰουλία Δομιτία ἔζησεν
ἔτη ζ´, μῆνας γ´, ἡμέρας ε´.
Γονεῖς ἐποίησ⸢α⸣ν

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photographs; lapis: Ο
line.3: lapis: ΕΠΟΙΗΣΛΝ

English translation

To the underworld spirits. Iulia Domitia lived for 7 years, 3 months, and 5 days. Her parents made this.

Italian translation

Agli Dei inferi. Giulia Domizia visse sette anni, tre mesi, cinque giorni. I suoi genitori realizzarono questo.

commentary

The structure of the epitaph is the most common for pagan epitaphs, with the invocation to the underworld spirits, the name of the deceased in nominative and his/her age, the names of the dedicant (in this case, the parents, who are not named, see also IG 14.483 = ISic001306) and the dedication verb in the aorist form (Korhonen 2004: 85-86). The nomen Δομιτία from the gens Domitia may have spread especially since the reign of Nero: from prosopography and palaeography, therefore, the inscription can be dated from the mid-1st century CE to the end of the 2nd century CE.

bibliography

    14.0481 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072 98 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028 3.5704 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252 Castelli 1769 151 no. 32 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084 Castelli 1784 159 no. 35 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083 Ferrara 1829 346 no. 2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002005
    85-86 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
